docs.text: america loves convenience .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after all , we're the culture that invented the cell phone , the 24-hour atm , and my most beloved , the remote control .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: yet perhaps this time , with ghosts of mars , we have taken our love of convenience to far .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ghosts of mars stars natasha henstridge as a tough as nails , pill-poppin' , martian cop , sent with her squadron to retrieve " demolition " williams ( ice cube ) from a remote mining town for trial back home .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when she and her comrades , appropriately dubbed " the commander , " " the rookies , " and the guy with the cool accent discover the town's residents slaughtered , they are forced to team up with williams to escape from the remaining residents' head-chopping , alien-possessed clutches .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: filled with a lovely overuse of storytelling flashbacks , flashes-sideways , and viewpoint changes , ghosts of mars is a hapless mishmash of poorly constructed dialogue and ill-conceived action sequences .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the only thing keeping this film from becoming an incomprehensible mess is the sheer idiotic simplicity of its story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ripped straight from the pages of a 1970s zombie movie , ghosts leaps from one convenient moment to the next , stopping only to kill the characters which are most convenient to lose .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: attempts at character interaction and development are rare and forced .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of these moments come off as kwik-e-mart wisdom , dispensed heartily around the slushee machine of life by the even-tempered streetwise hand of ice cube .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with a gun in one hand and a dynamite cap in the other , cube reminisces about his street life , comparing the zombie-stomping fun to " me and my brother when we was kids . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: apparently , crime in the bronx has gotten so bad that the residents have actually taken to ritually decapitating one another for entertainment .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but , even in the film's darkest moments , fate conveniently lends a hand , supplying heavily armored transportation and easily accessible rifles and dynamite .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: yes , in the future , man may travel to space and conquer mars , but nothing beats a good stick of tnt .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and as we all know , every police station , past , present , or future , keeps a healthy supply on hand .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: characters die , heads are lopped off , but they were only supporting roles anyway , so why should we care ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as long as you have plenty of narcotics , immunity is guaranteed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: eventually though , even the most well-trained zombie alien gets a bit uppity and needs to be taught a lesson .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what better way than by sacrificing a few minor characters to a convenient nuclear detonation , killing anything the machine guns can't handle .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: explosions are fun .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and even if the nukes don't get them , the conveniently placed dynamite packs on the train stolen from the set of the road warrior certainly will .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the end this film defines itself when our cop's tribunal pronounces , " is that all you have to tell us ? "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for , indeed , john carpenter has run out of things to say , and has instead decided to use whatever is convenient to tell a ridiculously bad story .
docs.label: negative
